items.title: Separate change callback with reading value
items.body:
### Relevant Package
angular/forms

### Description

I think the `ControlValueAccessor` has a performance issue, which cannot be fixed with the current design.

The root cause of the issue is the following method: `registerOnChange`:

```
interface ControlValueAccessor {
  registerOnChange(fn: (value: any) => void): void;
  ...
}
```

The callback has two responsibilities:

1. Notify the model that the value has been changed.
2. Provide the current value

This works fine when you have easy access to the current underlaying value and you can provide the value with each keystroke or change. But it is very problematic in the following cases:

1. The external state is not the same as the internal state. For example editors like Quill or Slate maintain an internal object structure for their state. When you want to write a markdown editor you have to convert the state to markdown with every change, which is expensive. Other editors like TinyMCE are based on the DOM, so you have to convert the DOM to HTML with every change which is also expensive.

2. The editor itself does not provide a reliable way to get all changes. It could be a bug, but sometimes it is just a feature, for example when plugins make a silent change in Quill.

3. You can miss changes. For example when you update the form state on blur only to improve performance and then press a submit button, you do not have the latest changes available, because the form has no way to force an update of all values.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to change the signature to this

```
interface ControlValueAccessor {
  registerOnChange(fn: () => void): void;

  getValue(): any;
  ...
}
```

This allows different approaches, for example:

1. You can call `getValue()` in your change callback to update your model on every change.
2. You can call `getValue()` in your blur callback to update your model on every focus lost.
3. You can convert your change callback to an observable and then use `debounceTime` operator to improve performance.

EDIT: For backwards compatibility we can either make `getValue()` optional or introduce a `ControlValueAccessor2`.

It is relatively easy build a wrapper of `ControlValueAccessor2` around `ControlValueAccessor1` in angular itself, e.g.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I have not found a good workaround.

items.title: Service Worker: allow service worker to checkForUpdate and activateUpdate before bootstraping the AppModule

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

items.body:
# 🚀 feature request
Provide a way to check for updates and activate them before the main AppModule is bootstrapped.

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/service-worker

### Description
Currently, if we use the service worker module(which we want to use in order to support offline mode) we have no choice but always serve a cached(potentially outdated) version when a user opens our app. And only then we can check for updates in the background.

What we want is to check for updates before bootstrapping the app and if there are any then first activate them and only after that bootstrap an app. We want to be sure that a user starts her working day with a fresh version of our app (if for example there was an overnight update).

We considered force page reload and showing a prompt for a user to activate a new version but that would not be the best UX choice in our scenarios(we do updates a couple of times daily).


### Describe the solution you'd like
Provide an API to access service worker's `checkForUpdate`, `available` and `activateUpdate` properties outside of a module/service so it can be done in `main.ts`.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
We can't remove the service worker since we want offline support.
We can't force refresh as it's a bad UX for us(we can on navigation between routes but that would be too late)
We can't show prompt as it will appear almost every morning for the user.

We consider showing a spinner in app.component until we make all checks through the ServiceWorkerModule as an alternative but that would be a waste of the device's(in case of mobile) resources to parse and execute all JS to then find out it's not needed.

items.title: Form status is not correctly propagated in the nested CVA forms

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

items.body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package
```
"@angular/animations": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/common": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/compiler": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/core": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/forms": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/platform-browser": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^10.0.9",
"@angular/router": "^10.0.9",
```

### Is this a regression?
No, I don't think so, it's also reproducible in Angular 9.

### Description

I'm not sure if it's a bug but I find this behavior strange and I cannot find any information in the documentation about that. 
This is about the nested forms, CVA and validation. 

I have a nested form structure:
- form container (not CVA, it contains CVA form controls)
- parent form (CVA) appended to the form container ☝️ 
- child form (CVA) appended to the parent form ☝️ 

Only the child form has a _required_ validator attached. I have also a button attached to the form container which should be disabled if the form (in the form container) is invalid. The problem is that the form container is valid, although the parent form and its child are invalid. 

Once I attach any validator to the parent form, the invalid event will be propagated to the form container. I'm not sure if it's a bug but I would expect that if the both forms are invalid (parent and child), the status should be also propagated to the form container and it's not. It's only propagated once the parent form has a validator attached. 

I prepared a stackblitz so that you can reproduce the issue. I would be very grateful if you could comment on that.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-hhfydn

items.title: ContentChildren query lags in change detection when wrapped by template

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

items.body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core probably ### Is this a regression? No, the issue was present at least since version 7 ### Description When your component has `ng-template` in its content for later instantiation and inside that template there's a list of items — you can query those children with `ContentChildren` once you instantiate the template. However change detection in them lags a cycle. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-content-children-query-bug ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
10
**Anything else relevant?** In the reproduction Stackblitz, type a short string into input. This string is then broken into chars and spread into a list of DIVs with a 2 seconds delay. You can even see that "content checked" is printed to console when the list updates. However the `QueryList` of children is not refreshed. Also note that I had to wrap `setInterval` into `runOutsideAngular`. Otherwise it would create a tick that refreshes the query, even though both components are `OnPush`.

items.title: Angular project not at all loading in IE11. Error: Invalid range in character set
items.body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package I believe the issue caused by @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No, last I checked in 10.0.x I didn't have this issue ### Description When I initially deployed Angular(10.x) project to Production, I was able to see the home page without any issues. After recent update to 10.1.x, The home page is not loading at all and I see error message **SCRIPT5021: Invalid range in character set** as shown below ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction I am not sure I can reproduce this. But opening the [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/angular/aqoovjqrmao?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-platform-overview-example.html ) URL in IE 11 does not load anything. Issue might be similar. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
SCRIPT5021: Invalid range in character set
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 10.1.2
Node: 14.12.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version

**Anything else relevant?** Browser: Internet Explorer 11 Version: 11.1397.177630.0

items.title: Losing `@types/*` packages types on second+ server rebuild

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

items.body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.x ### Description Somehow typescript loses `@types/*` types on second+ angular app rebuild. It works fine on devserver start, first rebuild and on build command. We faced this for `require` and some webpack typings in our apps after update ng9 -> ng10. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction - clone https://github.com/artaommahe/angular-cli-missing-types-on-rebuild - open app.component.ts - start dev server - no errors - trigger rebuild (e.g. add comment) - no errors - trigger second rebuild - see type error Adding `types: ['node']` solves `require` type error, but you need to add all `@types/*` packages for big projects. `@types/*` should work fine without any additional actions. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

    ERROR in src/app/app.component.ts:2:1 - error TS2580: Cannot find name 'require'. Do you need to install type definitions for node? Try `npm i @types/node`.
    
    2 require('./test.svg');
      ~~~~~~~
## 🌍 Your Environment 

PS D:\projects\issues\angular-cli-missing-types-on-rebuild> yarn ng version
yarn run v1.16.0
$ ng version

  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 10.1.2
Node: 12.18.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
